content.description:
P1 5.4 use any one of the many grid bolted routes to gain access to the ledge at the base of the second pitch.  

  P2 5.6 climb up past bolts on the right edge of the wall atop the slabs.  

  P3 5.5 climb straight up slab to lower anchor, or climb up and left for one very long pitch to the true summit.
content.protection: Bolts. This climb can be led entirely on natural gear, use aliens and offset nuts. Also bring a few pieces if going to the true summit.
content.location: Start at lower end of the slabs.

content.description: Like the nearby Diamond Slipper, this climb's name let's you know what kind of climbing you are in for on this one, if it wasn't obvious just looking at it. Follow a right-trending diagonal ramp until a couple of bolts protect a turn left up a steep bulge (crux) to an anchor.

If your introducing climbing to a friend, this is a great climb to do so! Pitch 1: Climb the slab past a few 5.8 moves (crux) in the lower section then its a fun haul to the anchors. Pitch 2: Very fun climbing almost gym like on sustained .8/.9. Easy single rope rappels from both sets of chains.
content.protection: (15 draws) Bolts to fixed top anchors with rap rings.
content.location: Walk up to the northern slab and look for the obvious flat ground in a bowl shaped area (Nice staging area). The line you want is the 3rd line from the right on it's own flat starting wall.

content.description: Climb the head wall above “Jinxed”. Crux is at the top with a hard over hanging boulder move.
content.protection: Good Bolts all the way up, rap down the line.
content.location: In between “The Malediction Route” and “Northern Lights”

content.description: On the upper headwall of the north slab.  Good route with delicate friction moves. The crux is getting the second bolt but it doesn't let up until the slab on top.
content.location: between Northern Lights and Toy Box, generally.

content.description: NW Corner of the flagston formation.
